items.label: lem-wasserstein-revival
items.title: Wasserstein Contraction for Proportional Resampling (Conjecture)
items.content:
729: :label: lem-wasserstein-revival
730: 
731: If $\mathcal{R}$ is viewed as resampling from $\tilde{\rho} = \rho / \|\rho\|_{L^1}$, then:
732: 
733: $$
734: W_2(\mathcal{R}(\rho), \mathcal{R}(\sigma)) \le \lambda (1-m) W_2(\tilde{\rho}, \tilde{\sigma})
735: $$
736: 
737: for some average dead mass $m \approx (m_\rho + m_\sigma)/2$.

items.label: lem-irreducibility
items.title: Irreducibility
items.content:
1450: :label: lem-irreducibility
1451: 
1452: The Markov process $(X_t, V_t)$ generated by $\mathcal{L}$ (with revival) is **irreducible**: for any two open sets $A, B \subset \Omega$ and any initial point $(x_0, v_0) \in A$, there exists $t > 0$ such that:
1453: 
1454: $$
1455: \mathbb{P}_{(x_0,v_0)}[(X_t, V_t) \in B] > 0
1456: $$

items.label: lem-drift-condition-corrected
items.title: Drift Condition with Quadratic Lyapunov
items.content:
2088: :label: lem-drift-condition-corrected
2089: 
2090: Under Assumptions A1 (confinement) and A3 (friction), there exist constants $a, b, c > 0$ such that the quadratic Lyapunov function:
2091: 
2092: $$
2093: V(x,v) = a|x|^2 + 2b x \cdot v + c|v|^2
2094: $$
2095: 
2096: satisfies a drift condition with respect to the **adjoint operator** $\mathcal{L}^*$:
2097: 
2098: $$
2099: \mathcal{L}^*[V] \le -\beta V + C
2100: $$
items.raw_directive:
2085: Moreover, the simple Lyapunov $V = |x|^2 + |v|^2$ does NOT satisfy a drift condition due to the cross-term $x \cdot v$. We need a **quadratic form** that handles this coupling.
2086: 
2087: :::{prf:lemma} Drift Condition with Quadratic Lyapunov
2088: :label: lem-drift-condition-corrected
2089: 
2090: Under Assumptions A1 (confinement) and A3 (friction), there exist constants $a, b, c > 0$ such that the quadratic Lyapunov function:
2091: 
2092: $$
2093: V(x,v) = a|x|^2 + 2b x \cdot v + c|v|^2
2094: $$
2095: 
2096: satisfies a drift condition with respect to the **adjoint operator** $\mathcal{L}^*$:
2097:

items.label: lem-fisher-bound
items.title: Fisher Information Bound
items.content:
3530: :label: lem-fisher-bound
3531: 
3532: There exists a constant $c_F > 0$ such that:
3533: 
3534: $$
3535: I_v(\rho) \ge c_F I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{rem}}
3536: $$
3537: 
3538: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
3539: 
3540: Consequently:
3541: 
3542: $$
3543: \boxed{I_v(\rho) \ge 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{LSI}}}
3544: $$

3791: :::{prf:lemma} Entropy $L^1$ Bound
3792: :label: lem-entropy-l1-bound
3793:

3795:
